meanings.sent1: She compresses the clothes in the suitcase to make them fit.
meanings.sent2: He compresses the spring to make it smaller.
meanings.sent3: The magician compresses the box to make it disappear!
meanings.sent4: Time compresses memories, making them seem distant yet vivid.
meanings.sent5: The chef compresses the burger patty to make it juicier.

meanings.definition: A pad of gauze or other material applied with pressure to a part of the body to control bleeding or reduce swelling.
meanings.sent1: She placed a compress on the wound to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent2: The nurse applied a compress to reduce the swelling on the patient's ankle.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's compress magically healed injuries in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a soothing compress on a wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The compress felt cool and comforting on his forehead.
